conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road.
The v-t graph shows the velocity of Cars A and B over time.
Car A has a constant velocity of 40 m/s from \\( t = 0 \\) to \\( t = 30 \\) seconds.
Car B starts from rest and accelerates linearly, reaching 40 m/s at \\( t = 20 \\) seconds.
We need to calculate the distance traveled by each car up to \\( t = 10 \\) seconds to determine their positions relative to each other.
Car A travels at a constant velocity of 40 m/s.
Distance traveled by Car A from \\( t = 0 \\) to \\( t = 10 \\) seconds is 400 meters.
Car B accelerates uniformly from 0 to 40 m/s over 20 seconds.
The area under the graph from \\( t = 0 \\) to \\( t = 10 \\) seconds represents the distance traveled by Car B.
The distance traveled by Car B from \\( t = 0 \\) to \\( t = 10 \\) seconds is 100 meters.
At \\( t = 10 \\) seconds, Car A has traveled 400 meters and Car B has traveled 100 meters.
Since Car A has traveled 400 meters and Car B has traveled only 100 meters at \\( t = 10 \\) seconds, Car A is ahead of Car B.
